item.title: Ticket #317 (Multiple copies of a plugin can be adding, leading to fatal errors) closed
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
20:

Added a check to avoid activating the same plugin twice, and changed include() into include_once() to avoid including the same plugin file twice.

item.title: Changeset [1712]: fix for #317: part two, avoid including the same plugin file twice
item.dc:creator: michelvaldrighi
item.description: fix for #317: part two, avoid including the same plugin file twice

item.title: Changeset [1711]: fix for #317: part one, avoid activating the same plugin twice
item.dc:creator: michelvaldrighi
item.description: fix for #317: part one, avoid activating the same plugin twice

item.title: Ticket #318 (WP causing "403 Forbidden" error when creating .htaccess on server ...) updated
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: Only way to restore access is delete .htaccess file.

item.title: Ticket #318 (WP causing "403 Forbidden" error when creating .htaccess on server ...) updated
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description:
Clicking the permalink suboption creates the .htaccess file and writes:

# BEGIN WordPress RewriteEngine On RewriteBase /wp-cvs/

# END WordPress

Attempts to load any page located in the directory where the .htaccess is results in a "403 Forbidden" error.

item.title: Ticket #318 (WP causing "403 Forbidden" error when creating .htaccess on server ...) created
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: Fresh checkout of CVS (09/26/04 11:34 a.m. EDT). My host doesn't allow for mod_rewrite (and actually has problems with .htaccess period).

item.title: Changeset [1710]: Typo. Hat tip: Marc van Veen
item.dc:creator: saxmatt
item.description: Typo. Hat tip: Marc van Veen

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description:
Please read the previous comments. It's fixed (or rather appears to have been a non-issue) in PHP 5.1.x-dev, but given the various timeframes for freezing of PHP 5.0.x(-dev), it's unlikely that the PHP bug will be fixed till at least PHP 5.0.3.

But in the meantime, if this bug affects/affected you, then vote for the bug to get PHP fixed... â€‹http://bugs.php.net/29944

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Here with php 5.0.2 the problem isn't fixed :(
